definition: to catch an enemy off guard with a surprise attack (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3])
pinyin: chu1 qi2 bu4 yi4 , gong1 qi2 bu4 bei4

definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
his/her/its/their/that/such/it (refers to sth preceding it)
(negative prefix)/not/no
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate
to attack/to accuse/to study
his/her/its/their/that/such/it (refers to sth preceding it)
(negative prefix)/not/no
variant of 備|备[bei4]
to prepare/get ready/to provide or equip
see 出其不意，攻其不備|出其不意，攻其不备[chu1 qi2 bu4 yi4 , gong1 qi2 bu4 bei4]
to win by a surprise move
to do sth when least expected (idiom); to catch sb off guard
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
see 出其不意，攻其不備|出其不意，攻其不备[chu1 qi2 bu4 yi4 , gong1 qi2 bu4 bei4]
(idiom) stay clear of the enemy's main force and strike at his weak points
to wait at one's ease for the exhausted enemy/to nurture one's strength and bide one's time (idiom)
to defeat the enemy by capturing their chief (idiom)
to gain the initiative by striking first (idiom); to preempt/to anticipate/preemptive
lit. speed is a crucial asset in war (idiom)/fig. swift and resolute (in doing sth)
lit. to pull a snake from its hole/to expose a malefactor (idiom)
to besiege and strike the relief force (idiom); strategy of surrounding a unit to entice the enemy to reinforce, then striking the new troops
a blitzkrieg strategy (idiom)/to resolve sth in the shortest time possible/to get sth done quickly
to know the enemy and know oneself (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War")
surprise attack/raid
there can never be too much deception in war/in war nothing is too deceitful/all's fair in war
